protocol_name: Purification of DNA-dependent RNA Polymerase from Synechococcus elongatus PCC 7942
protocol_name_html: Purification of DNA-dependent RNA Polymerase from Synechococcus elongatus PCC 7942
description: This protocol can be used to purifiy DNA-dependent RNA polymerase from Synechococcus elongatus PCC 7942 by heparin and ion-exchange chromatography.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data:
Culture:

 

To get a reasonable amount of RNA polymerase it is recommended to use at least 8 litre (OD750nm = 1) culture or in other words 10 gramm of cell dry cell pellet.

components.data: The dry pellets are resuspended in lysis buffer and subjected to 6 minutes of 2 second on/off sonication at a 40 % amplitude. After sonication the lysat is incubated with 0,5 µl of Benzonase® nuclease for 30 min on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The dry pellets are resuspended in lysis buffer and subjected to 6 minutes of 2 second on/off sonication at a 40 % amplitude. After sonication the lysat is incubated with 0,5 µl of Benzonase® nuclease for 30 min on ice.

components.data: Cell Lysat undergoes two centrifugation steps of 15 minutes at 15000 rcf and 20 minutes at 18000 rcf until a clear supernatant is obtained. The supernatant was passed through a 0.45 µM PFDF filter.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cell Lysat undergoes two centrifugation steps of 15 minutes at 15000 rcf and 20 minutes at 18000 rcf until a clear supernatant is obtained. The supernatant was passed through a 0.45 µM PFDF filter.

components.data: Next step includes, using a high pressure liquid chromatography (HPLC). Heparin column was equilibrated with 5 column volumes (CV) of loading buffer. The lysate is loaded, and column is washed with ten CV of loading buffer. Followed by 10 CV of washing buffer. Elution is done by 10 CV of elution buffer. The column is washed with column cleaning buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.annotation: Washing step is crucial for further purification! One have to be sure that the elution buffer is fully exchanged with washing buffer to ensure binding of the RNA polymerase onto the Ion-exchange column.
source_data.thread_text: Washing step is crucial for further purification! One have to be sure that the elution buffer is fully exchanged with washing buffer to ensure binding of the RNA polymerase onto the Ion-exchange column.

components.data: The column was equilibrated with five column volumes (CV) of loading buffer. Suspension was loaded onto column with loading buffer and continuously washed until the OD280nm reading drops to the baseline. Then a gradient of 50 CV from 250mM to 600mM NaCl [10mM TrisHCl pH 7.9, 0.1 mM DTT, 0.1 mM EDTA, 0.5% Glycerol] was applied. Final wash of the column is done with column cleaning buffer.

components.data: Again fractions containing RNA polymerase were concentrated with Vivaspin® 500 µL 5K ultrafiltration spin columns washed with loading buffer several times. Use the same ultrafiltration spin column to change buffer and concentrate RNA polymerase with storage buffer. To validate your sample one can use western blotting or mass spectrometry. Samples are stored at -20°C.
